posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
This is a high AC nuke mage built for medium/high magic PvM and PvP. It combines Auto Still 3, Divine Shield, and Improved Expertise in order to reach a high AC, with Bigby's Interposing Hand adding an effective +10 AC against susceptible opponents. The build is designed for environments where DC spells are borderline useless and consequently taking Epic Spell Focus is pointless. It is also designed for environments where +5 AC items (or better) are easily available, hence not taking Epic Mage Armor in the build. In a +5 AC environment this results in a build with 80 AC (90 effective AC), decent Concentration, great saves, Evasion, disease and fear immunity, and a lot of nuke spells.

Do not play this build if Expertise doesn't work while casting on your server. I will post a variant below which does not use Expertise.

The main downside of this build is the low HP, when fully buffed it only has 542 HP. For experienced mage players this might not be much of an issue, but it can cause problems when facing several hard hitting enemies at once. Encumberance is also an issue, STR is the main ability to buff after CON and CHA. Alternatively, using a large shield instead of a tower shield will give 30 lbs spare carry capacity at the cost of 1 AC.

I chose to end the build with 32 CHA, since when fully buffed to 44 CHA this results in an extra level 5 and level 9 spell slot compared to 42 CHA. Dropping two (or more) Great Charisma feats will free up epic feats at the cost of spell slots. For example, these feats could be Armor Skin, Epic Fortitude, Epic Reflexes, ESF: Discipline, EMA, Extend Spell, or Toughness.

The one rank in Lore is a spare skill point, it can be moved elsewhere without affecting the build.

This is a variant of the above build made for environments where Expertise is disabled while casting.

CC, Exp, ICC, and IExp have been replaced with Armor Skin, Craft Wand, Extend Spell, and Toughness. Most of what I wrote for the above build also applies to this build. Instead of 80 AC (90 effective AC) this build has 72 AC (82 effective AC). It also has 40 HP more than the above build, but even with 582 HP I would advise being cautious when fighting multiple hard hitting foes.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Those are both good builds

Although you have forgotten to reference my recent divine glory draft in your "There are several builds on the ECB that have 30+ Sorcerer levels and Divine Shield." list which was posted yesterday

If you compare it to my build draft, you gain: 
- evasion, +4 tumble AC, Monk UBAB, max discipline (all gained at level 40)
- faster divine grace for +saves, fear immunity, lay on hands, remove disease

At the cost of:
- animal domain summons, potential healing domain for empowered cures
- a later divine shield (level 3 vs 18)
- 2 caster levels + 1 epic bonus sorc feat
- some small  difference in stats (ie 14 str / 14 int in my build draft vs 13 str / 13 int in yours)

Auto-still / improved expertise can be added as desired for either our builds to what is best for the environment

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
It was about time that you posted one of your "nuke" mage builds, Yunim, and here we even get two variants tailored for different mods/situations. 
I like them both. The way you choose a relatively high Charisma dispite this not being a DC build still gives better saves and more spell-slots (if a sorcerer has such things as spell-slots).
The way you drop Improved combat casting the moment you drop the expertise feats also deserves a comment. You can only be in one combat mode at the time. With a high concentration, you don't need ICC when you cast in defensive casting mode. But when in expertise mode you cannot be in defensive casting mode at the same time, and then ICC protects against attacks of opportunity when casting. I suppose that is the reasoning behind your choice.
You have explained why you want charisma 32 with the extra lvl 5 and 9 casting when charisma is capped. Could it be worth it to drop charisma to 30 and add AS and ESF discipline?

I like the "cuteness" of adding rogue skills here. If you have an ample supply of skill boosting items available, I can see the point of opening the skills up, so you don't need your pixie there all the time.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
When I post finished builds I only post similar builds that are in the online archives or are in the Level 40 Builds subforum. When I post builds to the Unfinalized Builds section I include any relevant builds that I find, finalised or otherwise.

You're right about dropping ICC, as soon as you can use Defensive Casting mode reliably it should be on permanently unless you want to trigger AoOs.
Dropping CHA for other feats depends on both the environment and personal choice. Balancing CHA with a potential +2 AC, +10 Discipline, +4 fortitude or reflex is best left to the player. Personally I make my PvP mages differently to these builds, but if I was playing them I would drop CHA to 30 on both builds for Armor Skin and ESF: Discipline / Epic Reflexes and ESF: Discipline.
Every build I make has at least 1 rank in skills that require training, they can be dropped without affecting the performance of the build.

14STR/12INT is the best ability spread for the second build, when I made the variant I only altered the feats and didn't think to check the abilities. This gives +1 Discipline and a higher carry capacity at no cost.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Sorc36/Pal3/Monk1 is a standard PvP mage, along with Sorc38/Pal1/Monk1 and Rog2/Sorc36/Pal2 to give a couple of examples. The reason I posted this build is because after searching the ECB I found that there were no other posted builds with this class spread. The closest I could find were two Sorc35/Pal3/Monk2 builds, which have increased playability (apart from the XP penalties) but are not optimised for level 40. In a +5 AC environment a Sorc36/Pal3/Monk1 will have at least 5 AC more than a Sorc38/Pal1/Monk1 at the cost of two caster levels and one Sorcerer bonus feat. Those two caster levels will make a difference when it comes to dispels, but the decreased duration and SPen aren't really an issue for these builds.

These builds will work in pretty much any environment with a decent amount of level 40 content where DC spells are useless, for both PvM and PvP. Alternative builds are better on PvM servers where DC mages outshine nuke mages, but these builds will work in any level 40 PvP environment where mages are viable.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Yes, there are multiple servers where these builds are worth playing over a Sorc38/Pal1/Monk1.

As webshaman1 says, it's because of both Divine Shield and the dodge AC cap.
A Sorc38/Pal1/Monk1 has at most 15 self-buffed dodge AC in a +5 AC environment: 5 (AC Bonus) + 4 (Haste) + 1 (Mage Armor) + 5 (EMA).
These Sorc36/Pal3/Monk1 builds easily reach the dodge cap: 5 (AC Bonus) + 4 (Haste) + 1 (Mage Armor) + 10 (Divine Shield).
If the Sorc38/Pal1/Monk1 doesn't have EMA then this AC gap increases to 10 AC, and in certain situations such as getting taunted or being hit by Curse Song this gap can increase even further.
